intro: Ageratina lasioneura, commonly known as the woolly ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Ageratina lasioneura thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique texture and color make it a standout in mixed flower beds and containers.
